com.github.dm.jrt.core.util

Class Backoffs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.core.util.Backoffs

  • public abstract class Backoffs
extends Object
    Backoff utility class.
    This class is useful to build a backoff policy, returning a delay in milliseconds to apply when a counter exceeds a specified limit.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 05/10/2016.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Backoffs.BaseBackoff
      Base backoff policy implementation.
      static class  Backoffs.ConstantBackoff
      Constant backoff policy.

      • constantDelay

        @NotNull
public static Backoffs.BaseBackoff constantDelay(long value,
                                                          @NotNull
                                                          TimeUnit unit)
        Returns a constant backoff.
        The backoff will always return the specified delay.
        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is negative.

      • exponentialDelay

        @NotNull
public static Backoffs.BaseBackoff exponentialDelay(long value,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             TimeUnit unit)
        Returns an exponentially increasing backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed as: delay * 2^(count - 1).
        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is negative.

      • exponentialDelay

        @NotNull
public static Backoffs.BaseBackoff exponentialDelay(@NotNull
                                                             UnitDuration delay)
        Returns an exponentially increasing backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed as: delay * 2^(count - 1).
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the backoff instance.

      • jitterDelay

        @NotNull
public static Backoffs.BaseBackoff jitterDelay(long value,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        TimeUnit unit)
        Returns a de-correlated jitter backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed by taking in consideration the previous jitter delay.

        Note that this particular implementation tries to scale the maximum jitter on the count value.

        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is negative.

      • jitterDelay

        Note that this particular implementation tries to scale the maximum jitter on the count value.

      • linearDelay

        @NotNull
public static Backoffs.BaseBackoff linearDelay(long value,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        TimeUnit unit)
        Returns an linearly increasing backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed as: delay * count.
        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:

      • zeroDelay

        @NotNull
public static Backoffs.BaseBackoff zeroDelay()
